revised_title: Non-Axisymmetric Instabilities in Viscoelastic Taylor-Couette Flow
tldr: The authors conducted a linear and nonlinear analysis of the viscoelastic Taylor-Couette flow against non-axisymmetric disturbances. They discovered that for certain conditions, the critical instabilities are caused by non-axisymmetric, time-dependent disturbances. The study found that at least one of the non-axisymmetric families bifurcates subcritically, making neither family stable. This implies a finite transition corresponding to infinitesimal changes of the flow parameters in the vicinity of the Hopf bifurcation point.
